Organisational Behavior

This module is designed to provide students with an introduction to psychological and behavioural approaches to the study of work and organisations. The course introduces some of the basic analytical tools and concepts from the field of organisation behaviour and work psychology that encourage an understanding of the behaviour of individuals and groups in the workplace

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Explain the relationship between motivation theories and management practices. [Knowledge and understanding, application, communication].

+  Demonstrate an understanding of the nature of organisational behaviour within the field of business. [Knowledge and understanding].

+  Explain the different factors that influence the behaviour of individuals and groups. [Analysis, problem solving].

+  Evaluate the impact of organisational structure and culture on business success. [Application].
